column4: I have a dualboot here and need to have a data partition to which both windows and ubuntu can write. would you advise me to make it FAT32, ext3 with the ext3 driver installed in windows or NTFS with the beta driver for NTFS write acces on ubuntu?
i would suggest using fat32, windows does not see ext3
ah, something learn something new every day... i would still suggest using fat32
